capabilities.name: Display Resilience and Courage
capabilities.description: The role requires openness, honesty, and the willingness to accept and commit to change, especially in dynamic outdoor environments and in managing cultural heritage.

capabilities.name: Act with Integrity
capabilities.description: Ethical and professional behavior is crucial in managing natural and cultural resources, and in interactions with communities and stakeholders.

capabilities.name: Manage Self
capabilities.description: Self-motivation and a measured approach are essential for independent work and decision-making in field operations.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Respect for diverse backgrounds and perspectives is critical, especially given the role's focus on Aboriginal cultural heritage and community engagement.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Clear communication and active listening are vital for teamwork, community engagement, and managing contractors.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: Collaboration with team members, Traditional Owners, and the community is essential for the successful management of conservation lands.

capabilities.name: Deliver Results
capabilities.description: Efficient use of resources and a commitment to quality outcomes are necessary for the maintenance and enhancement of park facilities and natural heritage.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: Planning and prioritizing are required to effectively implement works and maintenance programs in a dynamic environment.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: The role demands practical problem-solving skills for on-the-spot decision-making in field operations.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: Accountability to legislation, policy, and risk management is crucial in the conservation of natural and cultural heritage.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Effective planning, coordination, and control methods are needed for leading field operations and maintenance programs.

capabilities.name: Manage and Develop People
capabilities.description: The role involves supervising field officers and contractors, requiring skills in engaging, motivating, and developing team capabilities.

skills.name: Cultural Heritage Management
skills.description: Understanding and respecting Aboriginal cultural heritage and working with Traditional Owners to manage and protect cultural sites.

skills.name: Environmental Conservation
skills.description: Implementing conservation practices to protect natural resources and biodiversity.

skills.name: Team Leadership
skills.description: Leading and supervising a team in field operations, including maintenance, construction, and conservation activities.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Engaging with community members, Traditional Owners, and other stakeholders in the management of conservation lands.

generalRole.name: Conservation and Cultural Heritage Management
generalRole.title: Senior Field Officer - Conservation and Cultural Heritage
generalRole.description: This role involves leading field operations for the conservation and management of natural and cultural heritage, with a focus on Aboriginal cultural heritage. It requires a blend of environmental science, project management, and community engagement skills.
